trans-unit.source: Describes a control that enables the user to edit an expression in an activity designer.
In [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/includes/vsprvs-md.md)], the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox> provides features such as IntelliSense when editing an expression.
Such features are provided by a component called the hostable editor.
The expression editing interface is extensible and the editor used for editing expressions can be replaced.
This component is not available for use in applications that are being re-hosted outside [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/includes/vsprvs-md.md)].
**ExpressionTextBlock** works in the following manner when you edit an expression.

When you click on an **ExpressionTextBox**, an <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.View.IExpressionEditorInstance> object is created and a hostable editor session is instantiated in [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/includes/vsprvs-md.md)].
When you type inside a hostable editor, note that the features have two sorts of availability.
IntelliSense, completion and colorization support is available immediately.
Validation is called in the background and is available only after a short interval of time elapses.
Then, if your expression is invalid, the hosted compiler reports the error and the red error icon displays to the right of your expression.
Press the **Enter** key when the **ExpressionTextBox** has the focus to insert new lines in the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.View.IExpressionEditorInstance> object.
This causes a line commit to occur inside the hostable editor, which triggers a pretty listing and the display of squiggles.
The editor instance is destroyed when the **ExpressionTextBox** loses the focus, and the display reverts to a **TextBlock**.

If you are on the designer surface or in the property grid, the change to the model item is committed and all <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox> controls displaying that same expression are synchronized.
However, if you are in a dialog box, the change to the model item is not committed until you click OK.
When the model item is committed, <xref:System.Activities.Validation.ActivityValidationServices.Validate%2A> is invoked and the entire workflow is validated.
When you click on the **ExpressionTextBox** again, a new editor instance is created.
In the hostable editor, pretty listing, colorization, and squiggling occurs before you begin editing.
To bind the expression text box to **OwnerActivity**, use <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.Converters.ModelPropertyEntryToModelItemConverter> to set the data context correctly.
The following code sample demonstrates setting the data context correctly for binding to **OwnerActivity**.
For more information, see <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.View.IExpressionEditorInstance> and <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.View.IExpressionEditorService>.

Also see the [Using the ExpressionTextBox in a Custom Activity Designer](~/docs/framework/windows-workflow-foundation/samples/using-the-expressiontextbox-in-a-custom-activity-designer.md) sample topic.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the expression text box accepts returns.
`true` if returns are accepted; otherwise, `false`.
Registers the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.AcceptsReturn"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the expression text box accepts tabs.
`true` if tabs are accepted; otherwise, `false`.
Registers the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.AcceptsTab"></xref> dependency property.
Begins an edit.
The command used to complete words in the expression text box.
The command used to change the filter level from the **Common** tab to the **All** tab when you are using IntelliSense filtering.
This is available only when you edit an expression.
Gets or sets the default value.
The default value.
Registers the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.DefaultValue"></xref> dependency property.
Occurs when the expression editor loses logical focus.
Logical focus differs from keyboard focus if focus is deliberately forced away by using a method call but the previous keyboard focus exists in a different scope.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.EditorLostLogicalFocus"></xref> routed event.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether a commit is explicit.
Returns `true` if the commit is explicit; otherwise, `false`.
Registers the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.ExplicitCommit"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the expression.
<xref:System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.Expression%2A> is always required.

When using the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox> declaratively to bind to arguments, you must always use the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.Converters.ArgumentToExpressionConverter> to bind the expression to the argument, setting the `ConverterParameter` to `In` or `Out` depending on the direction of the argument.
Returns a <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem"></xref> that contains the expression.
Gets or sets the expression activity editor.
The expression activity editor.
Specifies a name of the expression activity editor option.
Registers the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.ExpressionActivityEditor"></xref> dependency property.
Gets the expression editor service.
Returns a <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.IExpressionEditorService"></xref> that contains the expression editor service.
Registers the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.Expression"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the expression type.
Setting the type is strongly recommended.

If you do not set <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.ExpressionType%2A>, you can’t use the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox> to bind to delegate types and you do not get validation from the hosted compiler.

This compiler validation checks to see if the type of the entered expression matches the expected type, and displays a red box around the **ExpressionTextBox** when invalid data is entered into it on an activity designer.
Returns a <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that contains the expression type.
Registers the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.ExpressionType"></xref> dependency property.
The command used for global IntelliSense in the expression text box.
Gets or sets the hint text.
Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the hint text.
Registers the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.HintText"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the horizontal scroll bar visibility.
Returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility"></xref> that contains the horizontal scroll bar visibility.
Registers the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.HorizontalScrollBarVisibility"></xref> dependency property.
The command used to change the filter level from the **All** tab to the **Common** tab when you are using IntelliSense filtering.
This is available only when you edit an expression.
Initializes this form.
This method is intended for use only by the markup compiler.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the expression textbox is read-only.
A value that indicates whether the expression textbox is read-only.
Registers the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.IsReadOnly"></xref> property.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether the expression is supported.
`true` if the expression is supported; otherwise, `false`.
Registers the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.IsSupportedExpression"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the maximum number of lines.
Returns an <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> that contains the maximum number of lines.
Registers the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.MaxLines"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the minimum number of lines.
Returns an <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> that contains the minimum number of lines.
Registers the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.MinLines"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the owner activity.
Returns a <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem"></xref> that contains the owner activity.
Registers the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.OwnerActivity"></xref> dependency property.
The command used for parameter information in the expression text box.
Gets or sets the path to the argument.
Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the path to the argument.
Registers the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.PathToArgument"></xref> dependency property.
The command used for quick information in the expression text box.
Registers an expression activity editor.
The name of the epression editor.
The type of the expression activity editor.
The string format of the expression.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether this instance uses the location expression.
A *location expression* (or L-value expression) is a type of expression that evaluates to an identifier and can be placed on the left hand side of an assignment statement.
When you are binding the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox> to an `Out` argument, you would set this property to `True`.
`true` if this instance uses the location expression; otherwise, `false`.
Registers the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.UseLocationExpression"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the vertical scrollbar visibility.
Returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility"></xref> that contains the scrollbar visibility.
Registers the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox.VerticalScrollBarVisibility"></xref> dependency property.
Attaches events and names to compiled content.
This class is intended for use only by the markup compiler.
The connection ID.
The target.
